name: places/ChIJzY19BidawokRQMUPzYg1RoI
formattedAddress: 68 Bayard St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 68 Bayard St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text: I delivered my daughter through Bayard OBGYN and it was an amazing expierience. Dr. Kwei was amazing at all my prenatal visits and even called me back when I was out of the country (I was very concerned due to an expierience there). I had ultrasounds at each visit - which is a rare practice. Thier system of seeing each Dr who may deliver your baby is also great since each of them rotate based on days of the week. I really wanted to deliver naturally and the doctors did all they could to make it happen even though I had to be induced. They are great. Only downside is long wait times on certain days of the week.

originalText.text:
I'm highly recommended this OBGYN
I'm previously with Dr. Kwei with my first baby 1years ago, but she is now stayed on Flushing branch not in Manhattan anymore, so I decide change to Dr. Xiao or Dr. Jessica, both of them really nice friendly and helpful for now my second baby, they anwaser all of my questions and explained all the fact about my health. Front Desk is nice and friendly all communication is really good nothing problem and happened on me.

originalText.text: I had an appointment with Dr. Siyu Xiao! And it was amazing. It was my first time going to the gyno so it was scary but she answered all my questions and was very helpful. I don’t know why people are complaining about the front desk lol they just do their job and what really matters is the doctor. The PA was also very helpful letting me know my options and what I could do bc my insurance didn’t cover something so that’s nice! Most places don’t let you know and just ask you to pay it out of pocket. Definitely this would be my to go place :)

originalText.text: Not sure why the Google reviews written before are of a low rating. Personally, Dr. Betty Nyelin and Dr. Roland Nyelin are both my absolute favorite doctors due to them being my primary doctors (I have been seeing them from day 1). I did have other visits with other providers (Flora Lau, PA; Dr. Kecia Gerlach; Dr. Erin Rohde) to have the team get accustomed to my background/needs before my delivery and all of the encounters have been very pleasant, and I learn a lot in terms of what we did/what to expect for my next visit. My questions and needs are always addressed. When I call the office, the receptionist staff are responsive/quick. One time I was stuck waiting on the elevator queue for a visit at the Centre St. location for my glucose tolerance test- as soon as I walked in, the receptionist told me to go in right away to get my blood drawn without needing me to check in or giving me a hard time. The offices (Centre and Bayard) that I have been at are clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. I can honestly say I would give 10 stars if I can!

originalText.text:
My review is mostly for the receptionist at this office. I made my appointment almost a month prior to my actual appointment date. It was my first time visiting this office after being recommended by a friend who currently goes here. When I arrived at the office, I informed the receptionist that I had an appointment for x time and that it was my first time here- to which she replied "you don't have an appointment, you clicked on the link that was sent to you via text and you canceled the appointment." I never received any text messages from this practice, except the two email confirmations I had for when I made my appointment and a reminder two days prior to my appointment day. She claims that she has the evidence of my cancellation, but I never received the text so how could I have canceled my appointment? I understand that I have a very common name and that must have factored into this situation, however, wouldn't a medical practice double check patient's information accurately to ensure they're contacting the correct patient? When I told her I didn't cancel my appointment, she took another look and realized that they must have sent it to the wrong person and that person canceled my appointment. After this "confusion" was cleared, she proceeded to ask me the reason for today's visit, which I said I'm here for my annual. She told me I wasn't due for my annual as "my last appointment with them was Dec 2021". Again, this was my first time here and I have a very common name. For the receptionists to not double check the information in front of them and confuse other patients with each other- I would not come back here or recommend anyone come here. You cannot be careless when it comes to verifying the correct patient in a medical practice.

After seeing the doctor, I was given a paper with log-in information to make future appointments/check my results on the website they use. The credentials don't work and I can't seem to find myself with my name and DOB- assuming they probably entered in the wrong patient information, yet again.
